result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan C Sorenson

records.addlTxt:
8:45 AM Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Ryan C Sorenson.  Attorney Craig Lambert in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State has made a motion for joinder to join this case with 22CF214. Attorney Jakobson has no objection.
Court grants motion for joinder. Bond is continued.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:38 AM Defendant Ryan C Sorenson in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Ryan C Sorenson. Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Not guilty plea to all counts.  Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:02 AM Defendant Ryan C Sorenson appeared by video, in custody, from Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Ryan C Sorenson.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Brian Machon is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a detective with the Nekoosa Police Department.  On 5/9/22, Officer Meyer responded to a complaint and Krista Fischer stated that she had an altercation with defendant on 5/8/22. Defendant slapped her in the face and caused her pain.  Defendant threatened to slash her tires and her vehicle became disabled and it did appear that there was a slash in her tire. He and Officer Berg spoke with Krista Fischer and she showed them drug paraphernalia that defendant had at the residence. Substances tested positive for methamphetamine.
On 8/12/22, Officer Berg conducted a traffic stop that was registered to defendant. Krista Fischer was the driver of the vehicle and defendant was a passenger.  
He listened to telephone calls from the Wood County Jail from defendant to Krista Fischer.  There was discussion regarding the prior domestic incident. Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. Attorney Jakobson cross-examines witness.  
Attorney Lambert asks Court take judicial notice of 21CF748 and 22CF214, cases defendant was out on bond for. Court takes judicial notice.
Attorney Lambert makes statement.
Attorney Jakobson makes statement.
Court finds probable cause in cases 22CF387, 22CF398 and 22CF411 that a felony was committed and the defendant it. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan C Sorenson appeared by video, in custody.
No contact with victim or their residence - KLF. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. $5000
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No contact w/victim or their residence - KLF. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan C Sorenson appeared by video, in custody. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
